intro: Podandrogyne caucana, commonly known as the Caucasian podandrogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Podandrogyne caucana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
